messageBody:
Hi,

I had faced the same problem but I got a way to do it. You just have to run
your tests as Java instead of as JUnit in Eclipse.
It seems Eclipse doesn't use the main() to run it.

But I have a similar problem with Ant. I need to run my tests in a loop so
that I can repeat all the tests in a class
with different data files. I do it in a loop in the main(). Till now I was
using Eclipse, so it was fine but now I want to
use Ant to run the tests so that I can generate reports. Does anybody know
how to use Ant so that it uses main()
for the JUnit task.
Or any other solution for my problem is welcome too.

Thanks,
Nusrat

-----Original Message-----
From: darin.hafer@... [mailto:darin.hafer@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 24, 2004 12:01 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Main() never gets called


I run my JUnit test from a command-line and I can pass in arguments to
the main() in my test. I run the exact same JUnit test from the JUnit
plugin for Eclipse, and I notice my main never gets called. It is
possible to do this from the Eclipse plug-in, isn't it ? Even though
I pass in a 'program argument' from the 'Run...' page, the main()
still never gets called. Please Help me solve this if you can. Thank
You.
